text: Brewster is a city in Thomas County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 291 people lived there. ==History== Brewster was named after L. D. Brewster, a railroad official. Brewster was a station and shipping point on the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad. The first post office in Brewster was created in September 1888. ==Geography== Brewster is at (39.362878, -101.376552). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Brewster has a semi-arid climate, abbreviated "BSk" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Brewster, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 291 people, 110 households, and 67 families living in Brewster. Of the households, 69.1% owned their home and 30.9% rented their home. The median age was 34.3 years. Of the people, 88.3% were White, 1.0% were Black, 0.3% were Asian, 5.2% were from some other race, and 5.2% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 8.2% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 305 people, 122 households, and 87 families living in Brewster. ==Education== Brewster is a part of USD 314 Brewster. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Brewster - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 314 , local school district ;Maps * Brewster City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Thomas County, Kansas
title: Brewster, Kansas
